it's probably really old it could have

back well almost
some 2000 years hello there I'm Philip
Goodman I'm an author I write fiction
and nonfiction and my latest book is may
we borrow your language one of the most
curious words it's not quite worthless
but whose in English is the ligature at
which of course we use all the time or
type all the time in emails and so on in
a funny way it's it's probably really
old it may be a version of the Latin
word ad meaning out of towards and it
could have been used in very old
accounts going back 2,000 years but it
was picked up again by Ray Tomlinson in
the early 1970s who was one of the kind
of pioneers of messaging and emailing
and he was looking at the keyboard on
the typewriter and looking for a symbol
that wasn't very much used and at
fulfilled that function it had been used
in accounts but but only in accounts of
an accountant service a pretty dusty
neglected key on the board and Tomlinson
used it and the rest is history
and it shows that language sometimes is
not just made up of letters but it can
also be made up of symbols and of course
of numbers as well
